summary: Carlton Goodlett was an individual who was re-elected to the Presidential Board of the World Peace Council (WPC) in May 1971, as documented in a cable from Budapest and a routing and record sheet summarizing American participants at the WPC conference. The documents do not explicitly state his profession or background, but his position on the Presidential Board suggests he was a prominent figure within the organization. There is no direct mention of his involvement or significance in the JFK assassination context within these documents. One document references FOIA requests, classification reviews, and related correspondence, but does not mention Goodlett.
significance: Carlton Goodlett's significance in the JFK context is not apparent from the provided documents. The documents focus on his involvement with the World Peace Council.
